thread.title: Leslie Jones Calls Out White Women Supporting Black Lives Matter In New Comedy Routine
thread.title_full: Leslie Jones Calls Out White Women Supporting Black Lives Matter In New Comedy Routine | PerezHilton.com

author: perezhilton
title: Leslie Jones Calls Out White Women Supporting Black Lives Matter In New Comedy Routine
text:
It sounds like Leslie Jones has a new stand-up routine, focusing at least in part on the hacking and trolling scandal that so seriously affected her life last year .
And from what is being reported by the New York Post and others, it sure sounds like Jones' new stand-up is edgy — really edgy!
Related: Leslie Jones On Milo's Lost Book Deal 
The comedian apparently took to the stage recently in a four-night stint at Carolines , a New York comedy club, and delivered a stunning call-out of white women trying to support Black Lives Matter .
In the call-out, Jones allegedly said: 
"If I see another 45-year-old white woman from Williamsburg saying ‘black lives matter,' I'm going to punch you in the mouth. Stop doing that." 
Whoa!!!
Related: Leslie Fought Back Against Milo!! 
But her ire wasn't limited to white women, either — and she touches on a lot of aspects of the social unrest and controversies that have erupted following Donald Trump 's presidency.
For example, Jones hits on the women's marches and other demonstrations that have taken place all over the country over the last several weeks, but she calls out black women — not white women — here for their (lack of?) participation, in her eyes:
"Not one black woman out there. Black woman at home watching [ Real ] Housewives of Atlanta. " 
And she also notes how, while she'd like to fall in love in 2017, she's more prepared for the apocalypse with The Donald manning the White House right now: 
"I want to be in love. I want to do that, but it's 2017, and we got a pig in office. The world is about to end." 
That last one hopefully doesn't turn out to be too true!
Related: More Leslie Jones News HERE! 
But what do you think about her Black Lives Matter comments, Perezcious readers?! All good because it's within the context of a comedy routine, or did she cross a line in getting too personal towards white women?
Let us know in the comments (below)!!!
[ Image via Derrick Salters/ WENN . ] 
Tags: black lives matter , controversy , donald trump , leslie jones , media minute , new york , politik , saturday night live , social issues , tech talk , tv news , viral: news
